newsitem.title: EL SALVADOR: El Salvador coffee crop seen reaching 3.2 mln bags.
newsitem.headline: El Salvador coffee crop seen reaching 3.2 mln bags.

text.p: El Salvador's 1996-1997 coffee harvest will end at around 3.2 million 46-kg bags, giving to an exportable output of 3.0 million bags, the Salvadoran Coffee Council said Monday.

Executive director Ruben Pineda said the harvest would end around 190,000 quintals (100-lb bags) more than predictions of producer groups and the Salvadoran Foundation for Coffee Investigations (PROCAFE).
Pineda stressed the figures still needed to be verified and checked. "They are being verified with our technicians. Some checks have to be made," he added.
Pineda said that to March more than 2.0 million quintals had been exported to March. El Salvador's crop in the 1995-1996 cycle was 3.2 million bags.
PROCAFE's original estimate from a base of 995 plantations of the 16,191 in the country, which has 180,000 hecatares under cultivation.
